problem.p: An engineer is considering using a column with one of the cross-sections shown below, A or B. Assuming the cross-sections have the same total area and the mode of failure is expected to be buckling in both cases, which will make a stronger column?

img.alt: (A) smaller square solid column or (B) larger square hollow column

choicegroup.label: An engineer is considering using a column with one of the cross-sections shown below, A or B. Assuming the cross-sections have the same total area, which will make a stronger column?

div.p: The hollow rectangular cross-section will have a higher moment of inertia since more of mass or area is further away from the center. Thus, column B will make the stronger column, assuming the column will buckle.
